Adhokshaj
essentially, compile time compiler will be written in templates

Condor
Actually 2 neural networks that improve each other

Adhokshaj
not that hard sir
let me start with something simple

Condor
Surely
Well, what you're aiming for (from what I understand) is to have a compiler improve the source code automatically without human intervention.. to avoid signature matches etc?

Adhokshaj
mostly to thwart static analysis

Condor
That said, I'm very confused by what you're trying to achieve

Adhokshaj
and partially dynamic analysis too
because you cannot attach a fucking debugger that easily
Basically, I can fake entire memory
from outside, you will see garbage, from inside code will see sensible data
cryptography is magic

Condor
True that 
And all keys can reside inside the VM
So far so good

Adhokshaj
yeah

Condor
So then, I presume that the compiler is outside the VM, as is the custom compiler that you're trying to generate on demand?

Adhokshaj
yes
and this whole C++ fuckery generates entire packagee in a single executable
with a single build command

Condor
Hmm.. how about feeding the conventional compiler other information (similar to how msfvenom can obfuscate payloads) during its compilation?
Putting the whole custom compiler out of the equation for a moment

Adhokshaj
umm
so after hitting build
I can go on a weekend tour

Adhokshaj
or, 1 week vacation in not so few cases?

Condor
Does it take so long to build with that compiler? 
Man, now I totally see why you want to build a custom compiler

Adhokshaj
it depends
if you put everything in templates
it takes too much time and memory
there are other ways to run code at compile time
while reducing templates

Condor
Hmm

Adhokshaj
if you are naive with C++, you end up paying a huge cost

Condor
Well I'm not familiar with C++ or any of its compilers but yeah.. I can imagine that having a compiler compile a second compiler and have that second compiler compile a third arbitrary program while it itself is being compiled is infeasible 
Hence why I would personally look elsewhere
Or at least have the second compiler finish itself before compiling anything else with it

Adhokshaj
actually, that shit is side effect
C++ has templates
and templates are turing complete
which means, any problem which is solvable, can be solved entirely in templates

prime no generation, string reversal, fibonacci or other sequenece, whatever you have done in clg
tree traversal, BFS/DFS search etc
all these can be done, entirely in templates
hell, even crypto can be don entirely in templates

Condor
O.o
You can build entire programs in C++ by just gluing together templates?

Adhokshaj
Fucking yes.

Sahil
Yes
I can

Condor
quickly runs away from the C++ hell

Adhokshaj
Again, turing completeness was totally unintended

Sahil
I glove c and c++

Adhokshaj
only after templates were shoved into C++, people noticed that this shit is turing complete

Condor
Programs that are glued together are obviously never efficient

Condor
Plenty of shit code that I've seen that just glued other stuff together

Adhokshaj
It depends upon who wrote the code

Condor
A program is only good when it does whatever it should efficiently

Adhokshaj
I write code which allows easy gluing. Yet that is efficient in runtime

Condor
And templates always have unnecessary stuff in them
Better write your own code instead of copy pasting templates and gluing them together that way is all I'm saying
But yeah, I guess the amount of unnecessary stuff indeed depends on who wrote it

Adhokshaj
templates solve a problem bro
see, when you need same code at many places, you use functions

Condor
If you wrote it by yourself, you can at least rest assured that it lives up to your own standards.. but I rarely find that to be the case with others' code

Adhokshaj
when you need similar codes at many places, you use templates

Condor
Yup, that's true
Hmm

Adhokshaj
they allow easy code generation based on a template, and instance specific details

Condor
But you do always create the codes yourself or review others' templates before using them, right?
If that's the case, the code should be reasonably efficient

Adhokshaj
depends

Condor
Maybe I'm just too turned down by glue code used by leets like Somedev 
Or the KaliFixer that Jack Xen made once.. that shit glued Python 2.7 and Bash code together of all things 
To do the full code rewrite that I did on that shit I needed quite a bit of intoxicants.. lotsa wine

Condor

Turns out that the formula that I was looking for earlier has to do with the Fresnel zone 
Never heard of it before though

Condor
And it turns out that if I can get both transceivers to be reasonably strong (like 500mW or so) I could still use a relatively high frequency
After all, both transceivers would be stationary.. So I can pin the signal down to a specific location rather than beaming it everywhere like RF equipment usually does, and with that significantly improve the range

Condor
I really want to debug this issue with my GL drivers but I can't get any meaningful debug logs going on and Nvidia bastards don't wanna dump core or say anything in journal when they decide to crash my system  is there any way to force the system to launch itself (kernel) and all user processes (particularly web browser and GL drivers) to launch in debug mode and dump core whenever something gets borked up? The chances of a hangup / freeze increase significantly when I fire up any web browser

Condor
So firing up web browser during tests will decrease log size significantly, however storage isn't a problem. I have about 10TB at my disposal and I wanna squeeze out any logs out of the session that I can get
